markdownRemark.html:
To whom it may concern,

Pretending to be good people in front of her
Being gentle to her
And no matter how many times she says "Sorry"
You reply with "No Problem"

But when she's not here
You say things like the opposite instead

Honestly
It's very troubling

If you don't like it
Then don't help her in the first place

"It's troubling. It's difficult. It's tiring."
Say it to her face directly

Don't trap her by going around in circles

Be strong, go ahead, move forward!
